title: Battle of Marignan
description: In a battle against the Swiss, French king François I defeats a coalition of Swiss mercenaries and Italian soldiers

title: Battle of Pavie
description: Emperor Charles V defeats the French army and captures French king François I

title: Leonardo da Vinci dies
description: In his castle in Clos-Lucé, Leonardo da Vinci die

title: Christopher Colombus arrives in America
description: Almost 500 years after the last Vikings were there, Christopher Colombus arrives in America.

title: Henri VIII sacred king of England
description: A young man, Henry VIII becomes king of England.

title: Start of the Civil War (USA)
description: The Confederates bombard Fort Sumter In South Carolina, starting the Civil war. It will be the bloodiest war in US history.

title: Saturn V leaves Earth for the Moon
description: Apollo 11 leaves Earth. It is the first manned mission to lay foot on the moon.

title: Rome was not made in a day
description: According to Roman myths, Rome was founded on that day, but historically, that's probably not the case

title: Octavian becomes Augustus
description: The Senate gives Octavian the title of Augustus and princeps, even though he's now known as the first Roman emperor.

title: Julius Caesar is murdered
description: Even though many people told him so, Julius Caesar doesn't care and gets murdered. He's knifed 23 times - even by his adopted son. Tu quoque, mi fili.

title: Tennis Court Oath
description: The members of the French Third estate join in a tennis ("jeu de paume") court and take an oath to never separate until France has a constitution.

title: Sad night in Texcoco
description: Hernan Cortez and the Spanish conquistadores are defeated by the Aztecs and retreat… well, not for long.

title: Crusade I : the beginning
description: Pope Urban II calls for the first crusade to liberate Jerusalem from the Seldjuk empire.

title: Jerusalem taken by the Crusaders
description: Jerusalem falls to the Crusaders. The population is slaughtered because of course it is.

title: Crusade II : Not so good
description: Bernard de Clairvaux preaches for the Second crusade in Vézelay. King Louis VII of France is swayed and promise to follow suit.

title: Crusade III : clash of the titans
description: Pope Gregory VIII decides the lost territories of the crusaders must be taken back and launches the third crusade, which will involve Frederic Barbarossa, Richard Lionheart, Philippe Auguste and Saladin. So much wow.

title: Crusade IV : a bit of a scam
description: Innocent III, the new pope, wants his own crusade. It will be the fourth one, and will only end up in destroying another Christian state. Yay.

title: Crusade V : let's try to do something guys
description: Innocent III is very stubborn and tries for another crusade, this time against Egypt.

title: Crusade VI : Frederic II's adventure
description: Even though he's been excommunicated by Pope Gregory IX, Frederic II decides to go for a new crusade, to reconquer Jerusalem.

title: Crusade VII : St Louis' contribution
description: French king Louis IX leaves for the Holy land, hoping to do something.

title: Crusade VIII : St Louis' failure
description: Louis IX decides to go this time in Tunis, where he dies.

title: Crusade IX : one again ?
description: The heir prince of England, Edward, arrives in Acre for a new crusade, which will be the last.

title: Constantin converts to christianity
description: Whether by religious illumination or by political choice, Constantin decides he's going to try a new God after a victorious battle at the Milvian bridge.

title: Hannibal Barca crosses the Alps
description: Somewhere around here, 100,000 soldiers from Carthage cross the Alps in a difficult climate, and with elephants.

title: India officially independent
description: By the Indian Independence Act, India and Pakistan are separated and independent.

title: Cyrus the Great dies
description: At around 70, the king of Persia (but also the king of kings, etc) becomes dead.

title: Carthago delenda est
description: After the Third punic war and a siege of 3 years, Carthage is finally destroyed.

title: Cleopatra VII snakes herself out of life
description: Maybe she didn't kill herself with snakes, but in the end, she's now dead and no longer a threat.

title: Battle at Actium between Marc Anthony and Octavian
description: One of the most important naval battles in ancient history, the battle of Actium is a triumph for Octavian.

title: Tiberius leaves Rome for Capri
description: After a series of unfortunate events, Tiberius prefers to go on vacation in Capri for the rest of his life.

title: Ashoka slaughters around 250,000 enemies in Kalinga
description: The Kalinga War is a bloody one, and will bring the Indian king to convert to Buddhism

title: Massacre in Cannae
description: Another battle between Hannibal and the Romans ends up in catastrophe for the Romans, though Hannibal will not be able to benefit from it.

title: Mansa Moussa's generosity crumbles Egyptian economy
description: The mansa of Mali, Mansa Moussa, spends so much money during his hajj in Egypt that gold looses value.

title: Shajar al-Durr, sultana of Egypt
description: A former slave and concubine, Shajar al-Durr is nominated as sultana (yes, female) of Egypt.

title: The 38-minutes war between Zanzibar and the UK
description: The British defeat Zanzibar in 38 minutes, marking the shortest war in history.

title: King Sebastian of Portugal gets lost
description: The Battle of Three Kings is a huge defeat for the Portuguese ; their king, the young Sebastian, is never found again, probably dead, but will be like an Arthurian figure for centuries to come.

title: Gran Columbia established
description: The Republic of Colombia, encompassing nowadays' Colombia, Ecuador, Venezuala and Panama, is proclaimed with Bolivar as president.

title: Tupac Amaru executed
description: The last Sapa inca is murdered by the Spanish conquistadores.

title: Jayavarman II establishes the Khmer Empire
description: Jayavarman declares himself "emperor" of the Khmer people.

title: Signature of "baqt" between Makuria and Egypt
description: The Christian kingdom of Makuria and muslim Egypt sign a peace which will last until the 13th century.

title: Baghdad is sacked
description: After a siege of 13 days by the Mongol prince Hulegu, the caliph surrendes, but the entire population (and himself) is slaughtered.

title: The Round city of Baghdad is completed
description: The new capital of the Abbassid empire, Baghdad, is now built, and caliph Al-Mansur moves his residence here.

title: Murder of Prince Franz Ferdinand
description: Archduke Franz-Ferdinand of Austria-Hungary is assassinated in Sarajevo by Gavrilo Princip, which will soon provoke war in Europe.

title: Founding of the 25th Dynasty
description: The 25th Dynasty, aka the Black pharaohs (because they came from Kush), is established by Piye after his invasion of Egypt.

title: Japan supposedly now exists
description: It is on this year that mythical emperor Jinmu created Japan.

title: Jerusalem falls
description: The capital of Judah is annexed by Babylonia and the temple of Jerusalem is destroyed.

title: Construction of the Second temple
description: It is supposedly on this day that the construction of the Second temple of Jerusalem is completed.

title: Battle of Marathon
description: In Marathon, the Greeks defeat the more numerous Persians, even though the odds weren't in their favour. The guy running from there to Athens is credited for creating the eponymous run.

title: Greeks crushed in the Thermopylae
description: The Greek alliance tries to defend itself against the vast army of King Xerxes, but they are still crushed.

title: Greek victory in Salamis
description: The Athenians manage to win in Salamis, marking the turning point of the (soon failed) Persian invasion of Greece.

title: The Mauryan Empire is established
description: After defeating the waning Nanda Empire, Chandragupta Maurya creates the brand new Mauryan Empire.

title: A Gallic tribe defeats the Romans
description: Gallic leader Brennus defeats the Romans at the Allia River, and thereafter sacks Rome.

title: Alexander the Great now rules the world
description: Alexander of Macedonia defeats the Achaemenid King Darius III and is now the leader of the world.

title: Alexander's empire cakeified
description: Alexander the Great is now dead and heirless. His generals decide to share the empire between themselves in Babylon.

title: A big lighthouse appears
description: It is around that time that the Pharos of Alexandria is erected.

title: One of the bloodiest battles in history
description: At Changping, the kingdoms of Qin and Zhao slaughter each other, with around 650,000 dead.

title: Qin Shi Huangdi proclaims himself emperor
description: The king of Qin, Zheng, will now be known as Qin Shi Huangdi, the first emperor.

title: Qin Shi Hunagdi will not be immortal, sorry
description: While traveling to find the Elixir of Life, Qin Shi Huangdi dies at only 49, maybe because of all the mercury he took to live forever.

title: Ptolemy V becomes King
description: Egypt has a new king, and they celebrate it by creating steles such as the famous Rosetta Stone.

title: Emperor Jing ascends on the throne of China
description: The new emperor of Han leads China in a golden age.

title: King Mithridates is finally defeated
description: He managed to annoy Rome for more than 20 years (88 - 63). But now Mithridates has been defeated by Pompey.

title: Revolt of the slaves led by Spartacus
description: In Rome, the slaves revolt against Rome, starting the Third Servile War, led by legendary Spartacus

title: Vercingetorix surrenders in Alesia
description: Julius Caesar besieges Alesia, and after 3 months, the Gallic leader Vercingetorix surrenders.

title: Emperor Ai makes his lover commander of the army
description: The emperor's lover, Dong Xian, becomes commander of the armed forces at only 22.

title: Start of the Yellow Turban Rebellion
description: In Han China,peasants start to revolt against the corrupt Han dynasty.

title: Cao Cao defeated at the Red Cliffs
description: Cao Cao and Lui Bei fight at the Battle of the Red cliff, one of the most decisive battles during the Three kingdoms period.

title: Valerian defeated in Edessa
description: In Edessa, the Sasanians triumph over Valerian, take him prisoner and (apparently) use him as a seeping stool.

title: King Ezana embraces christianity
description: In 325 o 328, Ezana of Aksum becomes Christian, making Aksum one of the first Christian countries.

title: Rome sacked again
description: In what will soon become a tradition, Rome is sacked by the Visigoths. The traumatic event marks the beginning of the end for the Western Roman Empire.

title: The Huns defeat the Romans at Utus River
description: Attila defeats the Roman troops in today's Bulgaria.

title: Fall of Rome
description: Odoacer forces Roman emperor Romulus Augustulus to abdicate, and sends the ensigns of the empire to the Eastern Roman Emperor Zeno, "reuniting" the two parts (though it is now known as the end of the Western part of the Roman empire.)

title: Volcanic winter
description: Welcome to the worst year in history, because some volcano exploded somewhere in the world and now everything's cold.

title: Creation of Kongo Gumi
description: The world's oldest company supposedly was created that year.

title: Toilet papers 🧻 exists
description: A Chinese scholar makes the first reference to toilet paper.

title: Pacal becomes king of Palenque
description: Pacal will be one of the longest reigning monarchs in the world, keeping the crown for 68 years.

title: First defeat for the Rashidun
description: The Rashidun army is defeated by the Christian kingdom of Makuria, stopping their progression south.

title: Big battle in Baekgang
description: The Korean Silla kingdom, Japan and Tang China clash on this naval battle, won by Silla and establishing them as a big force in Korea.

title: The Romans use Greek fire against the Arabs
description: During the First siege of Constantinople (674-678), the Romans end up using the mysterious Greek fire, destroying the Arab fleet.

title: A new capital city for Japan
description: Empress Genmei moves the capital city to Nara.

title: Battle of Talas between Tang China and the Abbassids
description: Even though the Arabs win against the Tang empire, the equilibrium of power is maintained in central Asia.

title: Charlemagne becomes the first western emperor in a while
description: A brand new Roman emperor (well, not so roman) is proclaimed : Emperor Charlemagne.

title: Leif Erikson becomes first European in America
description: Some Vikings settle in Vinland, but quickly start to have sour relations with the neighbouring "Skraelings" (the ugly ones - that's not nice).

title: Irish victory at Clontarf
description: The Irish defeat the Vikings, bringing down their power in the region.

title: Disappearance of al-Hakim
description: Caliph Al-Hakim disappears, and we still don't know what happens to him.

title: Saint Olaf II killed during a battle
description: While fighting against pagan jarls, Olaf II is killed in the battle of Stiklestad, which will later grant him the title of saint.

title: A new king in Georgia
description: David IV of Georgia is crowned, and will become one of the most successful leaders of the country.

title: Turning point in the Reconquista
description: At the battle of Las Navas de Tolosa, the Christians defeat the Moors, starting a new phase of the Reconquista.

title: Beginning of the kingdom of Zimbabwe
description: The kingdom of Zimbabwe is established around that time, and will leave the biggest ruins in Africa: Great Zimbabwe.

title: Mongols again fail against the Japanese at Kōan
description: The second attempt of the Mongols to invade Japan fails again, and again because of wind.

title: The Timurids triumph in Ankara
description: The Ottoman sultan Bayezid is taking as a prisoner by Timur, crumbling the state and bringing it to civil war.

title: Jan Hus is burned
description: After trying to reform christianity, Jan Hus fails and is burned as an heretic at the Council of Constance.

title: Pacahuti creates the Inca Empire
description: The king of Cuzco establishes a new empire, the Inca empire.

title: Creation of the Korean alphabet
description: King Sejong creates a new Korean alphabet, Hangul.

title: VOC created
description: The Dutch East India Company is created, soon to become the first multinational corporation.

title: Third defenestration of Prague
description: For the 3rd time in 200 years, people through other people from the windows in Prague. This time it will lead to the Thirty-years war.

title: Massacre in Jamestown
description: The settlers of Jamestown are slaugtered by the Powhatan.

title: Shah Jahan deposed by his son
description: One of the most famous Moghols emperors, Shah Jahan is deposed after an illness by his son, Aurangzeb, who becomes the new emperor.

title: Start of the Taiping Rebellion
description: The Christian Taiping Heavenly kingdom is proclaimed, starting the (very) bloody Taiping Rebellion.

title: Africa is now a cake
description: The Berlin conference carves Africa between the different European countries.

title: French forces are defeated by the Mexicans
description: At the Battle of Puebla, the Mexicans unexpectedly triumph over the French forces.
